post.description:
Make a request to a RikAI2-Extract and receive JSON response data.

#### File upload options
We support requests with Content-Type `application/json` or `multipart/form-data`. Note that `application/json` requests are preferred as `multipart/form-data` requests do not support all flags and fields.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data
- `[multipart/form-data]` **file**  upload local file from browser

Make a request to a RikAI2-Extract and receive response data in a ZIP file.
 To process your request asynchronously and send the ZIP file to an `outputURL`, include the `async` query parameter. 

#### File upload options
We only support requests with Content-Type `application/json` at this endpoint.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data

#### Response zip file contents
| File  | Description |
| ----- | ------- |
| .csv  | CSV containing a breakdown of the itemization |
| .json | JSON file containing the entire JSON response |
| .txt  | TXT file containing the entire JSON response |
| file  | The original uploaded file |

The default name for the file is an epoch timestamp if `fileId` field is not included in the request.

200.description:
Successful request.

With query parameter `?async=true` at the end of the URL, receive a JSON response and ZIP file uploaded to `outputURL`. Without `async` query parameter or `?async=false`, receive ZIP file data directly.

post.description:
Upload 1 or more files to a RikAI2-Extract for asynchronous processing. By default, a ZIP file will be uploaded to your `outputURL` for each document in the request. If you set the `returnJSON` parameter to true, a JSON file will be provided to the `outputURL` instead.


#### File upload options
We only support requests with Content-Type `application/json` at this endpoint.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data

#### Response zip file contents
| File  | Description |
| ----- | ------- |
| .csv  | CSV containing a breakdown of the itemization |
| .json | JSON file containing the entire JSON response |
| .txt  | TXT file containing the entire JSON response |
| file  | The original uploaded file |

The default name for the file is an epoch timestamp if a file name could not be extracted from file data.

get.description: Retrieves the status of an asynchronous request to `/rikai/zip/RikAI2-Extract?async=True` or `/rikai/bulk/RikAI2-Extract`. Identifiable by document ID or status ID.

answer.description: Model's answer to the question asked. For the RikAI2-Extract endpoint, the model fills the JSON structure that was provided for input.

context.description: Where in the document the answer was found.

confidence.description: Answer confidence score ranging from 0 to 1.

translated.description: Translated answer if the `language` field was included in the request

Answer.title: Answer
Answer.description: Answer model, data for each Q&A in response

model.description: Model used to process the document.

base64.description: Base64 encoded string for the file to extract data from. If it is an array, the base64 strings will be appended into one PDF then ran through the model.

question.description: Question must be a specifically structured JSON string or a dictionary. See our [prompting guide](../../../prompting-guide/model-specific/extract.md)

language.description: A language code (e.g. 'EN') or the name of the language you wish to translate answers into. [List of supported codes](../../../prompting-guide/general/faq/#supported-languages)

metadata.description: Custom JSON to be included in the returned response.

webhook.description: Webhook URL to send status updates and JSON response to.

webhookSendFull.description: Sends the whole JSON response to webhook URL upon request completion. Set to `false` to only send request status.

forceOCR.description: Will rasterize a pdf. Set this parameter to  `true` only if the input file is a fillable pdf.

forceBase64.description: Setting this parameter to true converts files to Base64 format before sending them on to the model.

fileId.description: Custom ID for document. Requests with multiple files accept unique fileIds for each file.

outputURL.description: URL where resulting zip file or JSON should be sent. Must be open to PUT requests. Required if submitting an async request.

outputURLHeaders.description: Request headers to include in the PUT request to the output URL.

returnJSON.description: Set to `true` to send a JSON response rather than a ZIP file to the outputURL.

webhookHeaders.description: Request headers to include in the POST request to the webhook.

baseModel.description: Base model used during data extraction.

settings.description: JSON containing any custom user settings specified in the request.

returnConfidence.description: Set to true to include bounding boxes and confidence score in response.

400.description: Bad request or failure to read. Request was invalid or we could not process your data.

value.message: Request body is missing required field(s): question

403.description: Unauthorized attempt. There was an issue with your credentials, model permissions or billing.

404.description: Not found error. When a request references an invalid endpoint or resource.

500.description: Model processing failed. Extraction model or LLM could not process your request.

value.message: Error during request to OCR microservice.
We made three attempts to process the model with no success.
